title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Act” means Civil Registration Act 2004 (No. 3 of 2004); 

“register” has the meaning assigned to it in section 13 of the Principal Act. 

Prescribed fees for copies or extracts of entries in registers
text_norm: 3 regulations-- principal act mean civil registration act 2004 (no 3 2004) register meaning assigned section 13 principal act prescribed fee copy extract entry register

title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: 4. (1) The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(b) and
text_raw:
4. (1) The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(b) and 
61(2)(b) of the Principal Act for each certified copy or certified extract of an 
entry in a register of— 

(a) births, 

(b) marriages, 

(c) 

civil partnerships, or 

(d) deaths 

shall be the amount set out in column (2) of the First Schedule to these 
Regulations, opposite reference 1 in column (1) other than as set out in 
Regulation 4(2) of these Regulations. 

(2) 

(a) The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(b) 
and 61(2)(b) of the Principal Act for each certified copy or 
certified extract of an entry in a register of deaths shall be the 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [552] 3 

amount set out in column (2) of the First Schedule to these 
Regulations, opposite reference 2 in column (1), at the time of 
registration only and where the deceased was less than 12 months 
of age on the date of death. 

(b) The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(b) 
and 61(2)(b) of the Principal Act for each certified copy or 
certified extract of an entry in a register of births shall be the 
amount set out in column (2) of the First Schedule to these 
Regulations, opposite reference 2 in column (1), at the time of 
registration only and where the deceased was less than 12 months 
of age on the date of death and the birth and the death are 
registered at the same time. 

(3) The prescribed fee payable in accordance with section 62(2)(b) of the 
Principal Act for each certified copy or certified extract of an entry in a register 
of stillbirths shall be the amount set out in column (2) of the First Schedule to 
these Regulations, opposite reference 3 in column (1). 

(4) The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(b) and 
61(2)(b) of the Principal Act for each uncertified copy of an entry in a register 
of— 

(a) births, 

(b) marriages, 

(c) 

civil partnerships, or 

(d) deaths 

shall be the amount set out in column (2) of the First Schedule to these 
Regulations, opposite reference 4 in column (1). 

Prescribed fee for authentication of copies of entries in registers

title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: 6. The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(a) and
text_raw:
6. The prescribed fee payable in accordance with sections 61(1)(a) and 
61(2)(a) of the Principal Act for each search of the index to any of the registers 
specified in Regulation 4(1) shall— 

 
 
 
 4 [552] 

(a) where the period of time within the search dates specified for that 
search is 5 years or less, be the amount set out in column (2) of 
the First Schedule to these Regulations, opposite reference 6 in 
column (1), and 

(b) where the period of time within the search dates specified for that 
search is greater than 5 years and the time taken to conduct that 
search does not exceed 7 consecutive hours, be the amount set out 
in column (2) of the First Schedule to these Regulations, opposite 
reference 7 in column (1). 

Prescribed fee for registration or alteration of forename of child
text_norm: 6 prescribed fee payable accordance section 61(1)(a) 61(2)(a) principal act search index register specified regulation 4(1) shall-- 4 552 (a) period time within search date specified search 5 year le amount set column (2) first schedule regulation opposite reference 6 column (1) (b) period time within search date specified search greater 5 year time taken conduct search exceed 7 consecutive hour amount set column (2) first schedule regulation opposite reference 7 column (1) prescribed fee registration alteration forename child

title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: 7. The prescribed fee payable in accordance with section 25(1) of the
text_raw:
7. The prescribed fee payable in accordance with section 25(1) of the 
Principal Act for the registration, change, alteration or addition of a forename of 
a child in the register of births shall be the amount set out in column (2) of the 
First Schedule to these Regulations, opposite reference 8 in column (1). 

Prescribed fee for notification of intention to marry

8. The fee prescribed for— 

(a) 

(b) 

the notification of the intention to marry, in accordance with 
section 46(3) of the Principal Act, shall be the amount set out in 
column (2) of the First Schedule to these Regulations, opposite 
reference 9 in column (1), or 

the notification of the intention to marry in accordance with 
section 46(1)(a)(i)(II) of the Principal Act, shall be the amount set 
out in column (2) of the First Schedule to these Regulations, 
opposite reference 10 in column (1).

title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: 9. The prescribed fee payable in accordance with section 67(1A)(a), where
text_raw:
9. The prescribed fee payable in accordance with section 67(1A)(a), where 
the age, civil status or death of a person is required to be proved by or under an 
enactment, shall be the amount set out in column (2) of the First Schedule to 
these Regulations, opposite reference 11 in column (1).

title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: 10. In accordance with section 67(1A)(b), an enactment by or under which it
text_raw:
10. In accordance with section 67(1A)(b), an enactment by or under which it 
is required that age, civil status, or death is proved, is prescribed in the Second 
Schedule to these Regulations.

title: 2007 ( S.I. No. 831 of 2007 )), 25, 46 (amended by section 9 of the Marriage Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations set the fees required to be paid for— 

• 

• 

• 

• 

• 

• 

• 

• 

• 

obtaining copies or extracts of entries in the registers of births, 
deaths, marriages or civil partnerships 

obtaining copies or extracts from the register of stillbirths, 

obtaining copies or extracts in the register of deaths where the 
deceased is less than 12 months of age on the date of death, 

obtaining copies or extracts in the register of births where the 
deceased is less than 12 months of age on the date of death and the 
birth and death are registered simultaneously, 

the authentication of copies of entries in these registers, 

searching the index of these registers, 

registration or alteration of the forename of a child in the register of 
births, 

the notification of the intention to marry, and 

the notification of the intention to marry when in a subsisting civil 
partnership. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [552]
